conclusion: Determine the time it takes for object B to return to the bottom of the inclined plane after the connection breaks when object A hits the ground.
Analyze the forces acting on objects A and B before the connection breaks.
Object A has a mass m_A = 1 kg and is initially at a height h = 1 m.
Object B has a mass m_B = 1 kg and is on an inclined plane with an angle θ = 37°.
The gravitational force on object A is F_{A, grav} = m_A g = 10 N.
The gravitational force on object B parallel to the inclined plane is F_{B, grav, parallel} = 6 N.
The gravitational force on object B perpendicular to the inclined plane is F_{B, grav, perp} = 8 N.
Since the string is massless and there is no friction, the tension in the string is the same throughout.
The tension in the string for object A is T = 10 N.
The acceleration of object B is a = 4 m/s².
The time for object A to hit the ground is t_A = 0.447 s.
The velocity of object A when it hits the ground is v_A = 4.47 m/s.
The velocity of object B when the connection breaks is v_B = 4.47 m/s.
The acceleration of object B down the inclined plane after the connection breaks is a_B = 6 m/s².
The time required for object B to return to the bottom of the inclined plane is t_B = 0.577 s.
